Buruk imej Malaysia
03 Nov 2019, 06:30 by Saiful Affendy Sapran
“KES ini memburukkan nama negara kerana kita sedang menganjurkan kejohanan bertaraf dunia,” kata Ketua Pegawai Eksekutif Litar Antarabangsa Sepang (SIC), Datuk Razlan Razali yang kecewa dengan kes kecurian di SIC ketika Grand Prix (GP) Malaysia, awal pagi kelmarin.
Jelas Razlan, segala persediaan termasuk tahap keselamatan sudah dipertingkatkan, namun masih ada pihak tidak bertanggungjawab melakukan aktiviti sedemikian.
“Kami sudah melaporkan perkara ini serta menyerahkan senarai barang-barang yang hilang kepada polis.
“Masih tidak pasti nilai sebenar barang yang hilang, tetapi semua pasukan dilindungi insurans,” katanya.
Jelas Razlan, berdasarkan maklumat awal yang diperoleh, kejadian itu berlaku sekitar jam 1 hingga 6 pagi kelmarin.





PASUKAN keselamatan melakukan pemeriksaan orang ramai pada Shell Malaysia MotoGP 2019 di Litar Sepang. FOTO Syarafiq Abd Samad

“Antara lima dan enam pasukan terbabit dengan insiden itu tetapi yang paling terkesan adalah pasukan Angel Nieto apabila banyak komponen yang hilang membabitkan jentera Moto2 dan Moto3,” katanya.
Razlan berkata, selepas mengadakan pertemuan bersama pasukan terbabit, pihaknya tidak menolak kemungkinan insiden itu dilakukan kumpulan yang arif dengan jentera kerana semua jentera yang digunakan di MotoGP adalah prototaip.
“Ada banyak komponen di dalam khemah pasukan, tetapi mereka seumpama tahu komponen apa yang hendak diambil dan apa keperluan komponen itu.
“Apapun saya serahkan sepenuhnya kepada polis untuk melakukan siasatan,” katanya.
Semalam sebuah portal antarabangsa melaporkan komponen yang dicuri itu termasuk set lengkap penyerap hentak, angkup, cakera brek, komputer riba, alat bengkel dan pemanas tayar.
Pengurus pasukan Angel Nieto, Gino Borsoi dipetik berkata, spring untuk fork dan penyerap hentak belakang turut dicuri.

Poor image of Malaysia
03 Nov 2019, 06:30 by Saiful Affendy Sapran
"The KES is tarnishing the country's reputation as we are organizing a world-class championship," Sepang International Circuit (SIC) chief executive officer Datuk Razlan Razali said.
Razlan said all preparations including security had been upgraded, but there were still irresponsible parties involved in such activities.
“We have reported this and have handed over a list of lost items to the police.
"The exact value of the missing item is still uncertain, but all teams are covered by insurance," he said.
Razlan said based on preliminary information, the incident happened around 1am to 6am yesterday.





The security team conducted a public inspection at the Shell Malaysia MotoGP 2019 in Sepang Circuit. PHOTO Syarafiq Abd Samad

"Between five and six teams were involved in the incident but most impressive was Angel Nieto's team when many missing components involved the Moto2 and Moto3 engines," he said.
Razlan said after meeting with the team, he did not rule out the possibility of the incident being a well-known group of machines as all the machinery used in MotoGP was a prototype.
“There are a lot of components in the team tent, but they know exactly what components to take and what the components need.
"Whatever, I completely surrender to the police for investigation," he said.
Yesterday an international portal reported that the stolen components included a complete set of loudspeakers, scanners, brake discs, laptops, workshops and tire heaters.
Angel Nieto's team manager Gino Borsoi was quoted as saying that the spring for the fork and the rear bumper were also stolen.
